parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "PyTorch",
  "details": {
    "environment": "zsh",
    "scheduler": "SLURM",
    "gpu_type": "RTX2080",
    "gpu_count": 8,
    "job_name": "dino_rpn_deep",
    "runtime": "23:59:59",
    "array_task_range": "0-10",
    "python_module": "torch.distributed.launch",
    "processes_per_node": 8,
    "nodes": 1,
    "model_architecture": "vit_small",
    "dataset": "ImageNet",
    "output_directory": "/work/dlclarge2/ferreira-dino-rpn/metassl-dino-rpn/experiments/$EXPERIMENT_NAME",
    "batch_size_per_gpu": "$BATCH_SIZE",
    "local_crops": 2,
    "checkpoint_frequency": 10,
    "epochs": "$EPOCHS",
    "warmup_epochs": "$WARMUP_EPOCHS",
    "use_rpn_optimizer": "$USE_RPN_OPTIMIZER",
    "invert_rpn_gradients": "$INVERT_GRADIENTS",
    "separate_localization_net": "$SEPARATE_LOCAL_NET",
    "stn_mode": "$STN_MODE",
    "deep_localization_network": true,
    "use_one_resolution": true,
    "conda_environment": "dino_newpt"
  }
}
```

This script uses PyTorch as the main application for deep learning. It leverages SLURM for job scheduling and resource allocation on a cluster with GPUs (RTX2080). The script launches a distributed training process, indicating a multi-GPU or multi-node setup. It employs the ViT (Vision Transformer) model with a specific architecture ("vit_small") for image classification on ImageNet. 

The script also utilizes a custom environment ("dino_newpt") set up with the necessary libraries and packages for this specific deep learning project.
